3/27/22, 9:28 PM TIME #VaccinesWork: 488,000 CARDINAL vulnerable children of Basilan PERSON , Sulu PERSON and Tawi-tawi to receive additional protection from polio Western Pacific Philippines ORG #VaccinesWork: 488,000 CARDINAL vulnerable children of Basilan PERSON , Sulu PERSON and Tawi-tawi to receive additional protection from polio 8 January 2020 DATE | Joint News Release | Cotobato City GPE The World Health Organization ORG (WHO) and United Nations Children’s Fund ORG (UNICEF) continue their support to the Department of Health ORG ( DOH ORG ) in the remote islands of Basilan, Sulu and Tawi-tawi ORG (BaSulTa) to reach 488,000 CARDINAL targeted children under 10 years old DATE with the polio vaccine.

To offer added protection to children in BaSulTa GPE , one of the priority areas, a further three CARDINAL rounds of immunisation for poliovirus type 1 CARDINAL targeting all children below ten years old DATE will be implemented.

The immunisation schedules include January 6 to 12 DATE for BaSulTa and Zamboanga City GPE , and Mindanao ORG -wide for January 20 to February 2, February 17 to March 1 DATE , and March 23 to April 4, 2020 DATE .

DOH ORG announced a polio outbreak in the Philippines GPE last September 19, 2019 DATE , with the first ORDINAL type 2 CARDINAL poliovirus case found in Marogong GPE , Lanao del Sur PERSON .

On November 26 DATE , DOH ORG announced the re- emergence of type 1 CARDINAL poliovirus in Maluso GPE , Basilan PERSON .

On December 6 DATE , the first ORDINAL case of polio after 27 years DATE was confirmed in Sabah GPE , Malaysia GPE , and revealed to have genetic links to the polio case found in Basilan PERSON .

https://www.who.int/philippines/news/detail/08-01-2020-vaccineswork-488-000-vulnerable-children-of-basilan-sulu-and-tawi-tawi-to-receive-additional-p… 1/2 CARDINAL 3/27/22 PRODUCT , 9:28 PM TIME #VaccinesWork: 488,000 CARDINAL vulnerable children of Basilan PERSON , Sulu PERSON and Tawi-tawi to receive additional protection from polio Lessons PRODUCT learned from the previous vaccination rounds in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region GPE in Muslim NORP Mindanao GPE ( BARMM ORG ) revealed that local government units need additional help, especially those in hard-to-reach areas.

The DOH ORG is working with the Bangsamoro ORG government and local government units for the implementation of the polio campaign with technical support from the WHO ORG , UNICEF and other partners.

“WHO recognizes that DOH ORG and local government units have been working tirelessly during the holidays to prepare for this response.
The high-level political support has been instrumental in the success we witnessed in the previous rounds, and urge all parties to ensure high coverage during this campaign to ensure that all the vulnerable children in these islands will receive the much- needed protection,” says Dr Rabindra Abeyasinghe PERSON , WHO Representative to the Philippines GPE .

“UNICEF is concerned about the plight of children in BaSulTa and the rest of children in BARMM GPE .

They are among the most vulnerable children in the Philippines GPE .

We must all work hand in hand to stop the spread of the virus,” Andrew Morris PERSON , UNICEF Chief of Mindanao Field Office ORG , says.

WHO has been supporting DOH ORG and Ministry of Health BARMM ORG in responding to the polio outbreak by deploying personnel to ensure that vaccination campaigns are planned and implemented effectively.

Before each campaign, UNICEF ORG helped the government procure supplies such as vaccines, freezers, ice packs, and vaccine carriers; facilitated the social mobilization component of the program, enjoining civil society, religious leaders and other influencers to spread messages about polio prevention; and lead the microplanning process with each municipality to ensure each child is reached.

During the campaign, UNICEF ORG staff provided technical assistance to overcome challenges in the field.

After each campaign, UNICEF ORG staff complemented the DOH ORG ’s effort in the conduct of assessments in select barangays to check if any child is missed.

WHO and UNICEF call on parents and caregivers to have their children vaccinated during synchronised polio vaccination rounds in priority areas announced by DOH ORG .
